meanings.definition: Remaining after the removal of a part or parts.
meanings.sent1: The remaindered pieces of the puzzle were scattered on the table.
meanings.sent2: The remaindered cookies were left untouched on the plate.
meanings.sent3: She joked that the remaindered socks were planning a rebellion in the drawer.
meanings.sent4: The remaindered leaves danced in the wind like forgotten memories.
meanings.sent5: The remaindered paint tubes added a splash of color to the artist's palette.

meanings.definition: A book that is no longer in demand and is sold at a reduced price.
meanings.sent1: The bookstore had a section dedicated to remaindered books.
meanings.sent2: I found a great deal on a remaindered novel at the sale.
meanings.sent3: He bought a stack of remaindered books to use as decorations in his room.
meanings.sent4: The remaindered novels lined the shelves like forgotten stories waiting to be rediscovered.
meanings.sent5: The library was filled with the scent of old paper and remaindered books.
